unnormalised: New Delhi Grapples with Deteriorating Air Quality Post-Diwali Celebrations
normalised: New Delhi Grapples with Deteriorating Air Quality Post-Diwali Celebrations

unnormalised: New Delhi, November 6th - Air quality across the National Capital Region (NCR) has plummeted to "severe" levels following Diwali celebrations, prompting concerns from environmental agencies. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) recorded an Air Quality Index (AQI) exceeding 450 in several areas, with PM2.5 levels reaching dangerous thresholds.
normalised: New Delhi, sixth November - Air quality across the National Capital Region (N C R) has plummeted to "severe" levels following Diwali celebrations, prompting concerns from environmental agencies. The Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) recorded an Air Quality Index (A Q I) exceeding four hundred and fifty in several areas, with P M two point five levels reaching dangerous thresholds.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, Head of Environmental Sciences at IIT-Delhi, stated that the increased firecracker activity, coupled with stubble burning in neighbouring states like Haryana and Punjab, are significant contributors. The Delhi government has announced emergency measures, including stricter enforcement of construction site regulations and increased water sprinkling on roads.

unnormalised: The worsening air quality casts a shadow over upcoming festivities. Many residents are postponing outdoor gatherings, including community feasts traditionally associated with the post-Diwali celebrations. Concerns are rising regarding the health impacts, especially on children and the elderly. Experts advise staying indoors and using air purifiers. The situation is anticipated to persist until weather patterns change and disperse the accumulated pollutants. Locals express concern over the annual recurrence of this issue and call for long-term sustainable solutions, including promoting eco-friendly alternatives during festivals.
